results.title: Con motto
results.brief_description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.
results.description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.

results.title: Comradeship
results.creator_credit: Nero-Film, Gaumont, Franco-Film, Aubert Film and G Pabst
results.brief_description: The dramatic story of a mining disaster shortly after World War I on the French-German border. Post war tension and bitterness are put aside when the German miners help rescue their French comrades. Emphasising worker solidarity. In German and French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nero-Film, Gaumont, Franco-Film, Aubert Film and G Pabst

results.title: Comrades: a Lanternist's account of the Tolpuddle Martyrs and what became of them
results.creator_credit: Skresa Productions, Film Four International, Simon Relph and Bill Douglas
results.brief_description: An itinerant Lanternist is witness to the rural unrest prevalent in Southern England in the early 1830’s. He arrives in the village of Tolpuddle where the farm labourers form a union and strike when their wages are reduced. Arrested and transported to Australia for seven years, the film follows the fortunes of the five men until their pardon and return to England. Bill Douglas’ only other major film after his autobiographical trilogy, is a similar homage to the oppressed poor. However, in spite of its subject matter, this is less grim. An important work from a great filmmaker. Cameo appearances from Vanessa Redgrave, James Fox, Michael Hordern, John Hargreaves and Robert Stephens.

results.title: Computing in the Aust. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert discusses the use of computers within the Australian Department of Defence, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18 1980.

results.title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia), Video Projects, Penny Robins and David Tiley
results.brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.
